org.jruyi.io

Interface ISession


  • public interface ISession
    A session represents a context of a connection.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object attach(java.lang.Object attachment)
      Attaches the specified attachment to this session.
      java.lang.Object attachment()
      Gets the current attachment.
      boolean contains(java.lang.Object key)
      Tests if an attribute with the specified key exists.
      IBuffer createBuffer()
      Creates an empty buffer using the buffer factory associated with this session.
      java.lang.Object deposit(java.lang.Object id, java.lang.Object something)
      Deposits the specified something to this session with the specified id as the reference-equality key.
      java.lang.Object detach()
      Detaches the current attachment off the session.
      java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
      Gets the value of the session attribute with the specified key.
      java.lang.Long id()
      Returns the session ID.
      java.lang.Object inquiry(java.lang.Object id)
      Returns the object deposited with the specified id as the reference-equality key.
      java.lang.Object localAddress()
      Returns the address of the local peer.
      java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Puts an attribute, which maps the specified key to the specified value, into this session.
      java.lang.Object putIfAbsent(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Puts an attribute, which maps the specified key to the specified value, into this session if the attribute with the specified key does not exist yet.
      java.lang.Object remoteAddress()
      Returns the address of the remote peer.
      java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object key)
      Removes the attribute with the specified key from this session.
      boolean remove(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Removes the attribute with the specified key from this session if and only if currently mapped to the given value.
      java.lang.Object replace(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object value)
      Replaces the value of the attribute only if currently exists.
      boolean replace(java.lang.Object key, java.lang.Object oldValue, java.lang.Object newValue)
      Replaces the value of the attribute with the given newValue only if exists and mapped to the given oldValue.
      java.lang.Object withdraw(java.lang.Object id)
      Withdraws the object deposited with the specified id as the reference-equality key.

        java.lang.Object remoteAddress()
        Returns the address of the remote peer.
        Returns:
        the remote address

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.Object key)
        Tests if an attribute with the specified key exists.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be tested
        Returns:
        true if and only if an attribute with the specified key exists, as determined by the equals method; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key is null
        Since:
        2.0

      • put

        java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                   java.lang.Object value)
        Puts an attribute, which maps the specified key to the specified value, into this session.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be associated with the specified value
        value - the value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key or value is null

      • putIfAbsent

        java.lang.Object putIfAbsent(java.lang.Object key,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Puts an attribute, which maps the specified key to the specified value, into this session if the attribute with the specified key does not exist yet. The logic is equivalent to 
         if (!contains(key))
     return put(key, value);
 else
     return get(key);
        except that the operation is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be associated with the specified value
        value - the value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key or value is null
        Since:
        2.0

      • get

        java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
        Gets the value of the session attribute with the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the attribute
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute, or null if no such attribute
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key is null

      • remove

        java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object key)
        Removes the attribute with the specified key from this session.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the attribute
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute, or null if no such attribute
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key is null

      • remove

        boolean remove(java.lang.Object key,
             java.lang.Object value)
        Removes the attribute with the specified key from this session if and only if currently mapped to the given value. The logic is equivalent to 
         if (contains(key) && value.equals(get(key))) {
     remove(key);
     return true;
 } else
     return false;
        except that the operation is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the attribute to be removed
        value - the expected value of the attribute to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the attribute is removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key or value is null
        Since:
        2.0

      • replace

        java.lang.Object replace(java.lang.Object key,
                       java.lang.Object value)
        Replaces the value of the attribute only if currently exists. The logic is equivalent to 
         if (contains(key))
     return put(key, value);
 else
     return null;
        except that the operation is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the attribute to be associated.
        value - the value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key or value is null
        Since:
        2.0

      • replace

        boolean replace(java.lang.Object key,
              java.lang.Object oldValue,
              java.lang.Object newValue)
        Replaces the value of the attribute with the given newValue only if exists and mapped to the given oldValue. The logic is equivalent to 
         if (contains(key) && oldValue.equals(get(key))) {
     put(key, newValue);
     return true;
 } else
     return false;
        except that the operation is performed atomically.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the attribute whose value is to be replaced
        oldValue - the expected value currently associated with the specified key
        newValue - the value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        true if the value is replaced
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified key, oldValue or newValue is null
        Since:
        2.0

      • deposit

        java.lang.Object deposit(java.lang.Object id,
                       java.lang.Object something)
        Deposits the specified something to this session with the specified id as the reference-equality key.
        Parameters:
        id - the reference-equality key
        something - the object to deposit
        Returns:
        the previous deposited object, or null if none

      • withdraw

        java.lang.Object withdraw(java.lang.Object id)
        Withdraws the object deposited with the specified id as the reference-equality key.
        Parameters:
        id - the reference-equality key
        Returns:
        the deposited object with the specified id as the reference-equality key, or null if no such deposit

      • inquiry

        java.lang.Object inquiry(java.lang.Object id)
        Returns the object deposited with the specified id as the reference-equality key.
        Parameters:
        id - the reference-equality key
        Returns:
        the deposited object

      • createBuffer

        IBuffer createBuffer()
        Creates an empty buffer using the buffer factory associated with this session.
        Returns:
        an empty buffer

      • attach

        java.lang.Object attach(java.lang.Object attachment)
        Attaches the specified attachment to this session.
        Parameters:
        attachment - the attachment
        Returns:
        the previous attachment, or null if there was no attachment

      • attachment

        java.lang.Object attachment()
        Gets the current attachment.
        Returns:
        the current attachment

      • detach

        java.lang.Object detach()
        Detaches the current attachment off the session.
        Returns:
        the attachment that is detached
